The distinctive features of fascism have been described as follows: # Powerful and continuing expressions of nationalism. # Disdain for the importance of human rights. # Identification of enemi

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/203.79.104.175|203.79.104.175]] ([[User talk:203.79.104.175|talk]]) to last version by DNewhall
Numerous fixes and clarifications to the article.
/* Islam and Fascism */ rm sentence about Bush (term was in use before him)
add WWI in intro (fascism can't be understood without WWI)
rm totalitarianism from introduction (debatable concept) and it's an ideology, not a "philosophy"
/* Definition */ rm erroneous statement on Hannah Arendt
rv (POV assertion; please rewrite it in a neutral way)
/* Fascism and the Catholic Church */ see talk page
restore statement about "fascism as a social movement employs elements from the political left". Restore word "Nazis", far more common in English than "NSDAP"
This is especially true with the disputed term [[Islamofascism]].
Removed material that belongs on other pages
Revert attempt to insert political bias onto this page
Removed unrelated, POV, and improper additions to "External links".
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/155.219.241.10|155.219.241.10]] ([[User talk:155.219.241.10|talk]]) to last version by 206.67.53.211

rv to replace rather important clarification, rm "example" that belongs at [[Fascism (epithet)]]
Revert. You need to be more specific. If many hold this view it should be expanded and additional sources should be cited to illustrate that the majority hold this view (which I think is incorrect).
/* Fascism and Sexuality */ > "sexuality", per MoS; one "citation needed" tag per sentence is enough
